{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3441567,"name":"","username":"JeremyS","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/a8b319/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-30T12:27:46.679Z","cooked":"

Our team has been looking for a good way to adapt a Kraken to a versa planetary. Like many teams we have a large stock of VPs from over the years and we wanted to be able to continue using them with the new motors. We didn’t find any solutions online so I’m sharing what we came up with here in case its useful to someone else.

Parts List
-VP stages and output of your choice
-VP 180 drive kit (217-6011)
-VP CIM Adapter (217-4018)
-2 3D Printed Spacers
-Wire EDM Adapter

Onshape

image752×750 123 KB

The thing that makes all of this work is this .25in thick steel adapter. One of our mentors had it wire EDMd at work, it has the kraken spline on the ID and the VP spline on the OD. You might get away with 3D printing this on light load applications but not guarantees.

We will probably have a few more adapters EDMd in case we need them, however we also went ahead and ordered a couple of MAX Planetarys which will be a lot less hassle to assemble and use.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-10-30T12:27:46.679Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":417,"reads":714,"readers_count":713,"score":2277.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":474032,"topic_slug":"kraken-x60-to-versa-planetary","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://cad.onshape.com/documents/ff28e68955fd76137e677aa0/w/95e392fe547a40ce9e563308/e/c4cd6bb217d730b1db0d588f?renderMode=0&uiState=672225558e93592fa2fa3929","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Onshape","clicks":57},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/kraken-spline-input-for-versa-planetary/491324/2","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Kraken Spline Input for Versa Planetary","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44024,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/kraken-x60-to-versa-planetary/474032/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3441625,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-30T14:25:12.893Z","cooked":"
JeremyS:

we also went ahead and ordered a couple of MAX Planetarys which will be a lot less hassle to assemble and use.

Given IFI’s development on the VersaPlanetary over the last few years (and, I’m sure, general feelings about Falcon competitors), I would deem this the long-term solution. The MAXPlanetary’s higher load ratings should also let you use more of the Kraken’s available power as a bonus.

But the custom setup for the VPs is undeniably trick, and I respect the hustle.

We faced a similar challenge, so we created our own Kraken adapter to mount onto the Versa Planetary. Additionally, we 3D printed a Kraken spline-to-VP spline adapter. Last year, we used PLA+ for the motor adapter and Markforged ONYX for the Kraken spline adapter, both of which held up without issues. Recently, we received a Metal X 3D printer and have started producing the adapters in 17-4PH stainless steel. While the PLA+ was sufficient for the motor adapter, we felt that using stainless steel for the spline adapter was necessary. Hope this helps someone else, too!

It would be nice to have a COTs solution to this. The Versa are lighter, more compact , and less back lash than the other options. A good choice in the right place. Even with Cims, you could over power them so they would be useful only lower power and numerically lower reductions with the Krakens.

One solution to those of us with less sophisticated machines might to make a bushing that has a spline ID and press fits to a bored cots cots VP spline adapter.

Hats off to innovative solutions!

VersaPlanetary Reinforced SplineXS Adapter.zip (1.9 MB)

Not exactly the same as what was posted above, but this is what we used this season to adapt X44s and Minions to VersaPlanetary Gearboxes. These are basically a clone of VEXs own Falcon Spline adapter, so it would require cutting the shaft to use it with an X60 and the CIM mounting adapters for VPs (for X44s and Minions, we used 3D printed spacers instead, which I included).

Alternatively you could also make your own custom adapter for an X60… that said, I personally would hesitate to use X60s on VersaPlanetaries at all, the X60 is a really powerful motor, moreso than what the VP is really designed for, X44s and Minions are fine though.

In any case, we got the Spline adapters printed through PCBWay out of Stainless Steel for ~$7ea (at the time), the other spacers we printed out of PLA.

PXL_20241203_014412841.MP1920×1080 315 KB

Sorry about that Here’s the links

  • Versa Mount Adapter to Kraken: View Here
  • VP KRAKEN coupler Metal Scale: View Here
  • VP KRAKEN coupler Not Scaled for metal Printing: View Here

These are designed for printing on our Metal X and require washing and sintering. Please review tolerances and adjust as needed.

I should restate what was said above: the Falcons were already too powerful for the VersaPlanetary, and needless to say, the Krakens are as well. Make sure you review the load rating of the planetary and use your best judgment. We ran 2 1:5 ratio with Krakens and stainless steel adapters with no problem on our elevator this year (which has no constant coil), so you can definitely get use out of it. The reason I feel the need to mention this is because we tried a much higher gear reduction on our endgame lift and we broke a few planetaries during testing. So make sure to review the charts and do your testing! All the best of luck!

VP-LoadRatings-20191031.pdf (11.1 MB)

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-08-04T03:32:23.459Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":154,"readers_count":153,"score":35.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":474032,"topic_slug":"kraken-x60-to-versa-planetary","display_username":"Josh Sirota","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56244,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6238 co-lead mentor"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-x60-to-versa-planetary/474032/13","custom_user_title":"6238 co-lead mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3701170,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-04T03:41:17.949Z","cooked":"

I’ve never seen those charts before (but I also hadn’t played with the VEX parts until last season), where did they come from?

That appears to be a re-upload of a file VEX itself published (and links off of the VP’s Docs & Downloads tab): https://content.vexrobotics.com/vexpro/Falcon/VP-LoadRatings-20191031.pdf

Will say that in the handful of years I worked with VPs (probably 2013-16 or thereabouts), we never had trouble when we obeyed that guide. But then, power levels in that era were vastly lower than now since 2016 was the first year the 775pro was legal and these days the 775pro is the floor for a lot of people.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-08-04T03:43:39.319Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":151,"readers_count":150,"score":55.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":474032,"topic_slug":"kraken-x60-to-versa-planetary","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://content.vexrobotics.com/vexpro/Falcon/VP-LoadRatings-20191031.pdf","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56244,"username":"gdgr","name":"Josh Sirota","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/f1d935/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-x60-to-versa-planetary/474032/14","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3701228,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-04T04:56:42.220Z","cooked":"

It’s worth noting that the closest equivalent on this chart (for the uninitiated) to the X60 would be the Falcon 500, though it should also be noted that, at least on paper, the X60 has almost double the peak power of a Falcon 500 (assuming those charts were running the Falcons without FOC enabled, which seems likely).

In practice their performance is usually closer than the numbers would imply, but I still wouldn’t push my luck with any extreme ratios (and especially avoid the 9:1 and 10:1 stages if possible, they’re fragile).

Personally, I’d be far more inclined to use an X60 with a MAXPlanetary and keep the VersaPlanetaries for Minions and X44s (which fall somewhere between a Falcon500 and a NEO in performance, and are far more size-appropriate motors for VersaPlanetaries).

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-08-04T05:00:39.449Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":14,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":144,"readers_count":143,"score":53.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":474032,"topic_slug":"kraken-x60-to-versa-planetary","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3095,"username":"Billfred","name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/kraken-x60-to-versa-planetary/474032/15","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3701277,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-04T11:00:42.540Z","cooked":"
cbale2000:

In practice their performance is usually closer than the numbers would imply, but I still wouldn’t push my luck with any extreme ratios (and especially avoid the 9:1 and 10:1 stages if possible, they’re fragile).

Personally, I’d be far more inclined to use an X60 with a MAXPlanetary and keep the VersaPlanetaries for Minions and X44s (which fall somewhere between a Falcon500 and a NEO in performance, and are far more size-appropriate motors for VersaPlanetaries).

You speak no lies. No matter how you feel about any kind of vendor, the VersaPlanetary is still largely a decade-old design and mounting a Kraken X60 relies on a CIM adapter that no longer exists in their lineup. (I don’t believe any OEM mount allows for the X44 to mount up, but the Minion should just be a game of spacers since it has 550 and 775 mounting features.)

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-08-04T11:00:42.540Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":74.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":474032,"topic_slug":"kraken-x60-to-versa-planetary","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/kraken-x60-to-versa-planetary/474032/16","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3701345,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-04T15:01:46.856Z","cooked":"

REV’s MAXPlanetaries do have an X44/Minion adapter, but you’re right that there’s nothing OEM for the VersaPlanetaries (I imagine litigation might have something to do with that). And while you’re correct that the hole pattern on the Minion theoretically allows for mounting using the 550 plates on a VP, the pilot boss on the minion is larger than a standard 550 motor (0.74" vs 0.512") meaning it would require either modification (drilling out) of the mounting spacer or some other solution.

I have heard hints from at least two vendors that may be working on VP-class planetary gearboxes, so I wouldn’t be shocked if we saw more native support for these motors soon.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-08-04T15:04:33.684Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":96,"readers_count":95,"score":34.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":474032,"topic_slug":"kraken-x60-to-versa-planetary","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-21-2139/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"MAXPlanetary Kraken X44 & Minion Input Kit","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3095,"username":"Billfred","name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/kraken-x60-to-versa-planetary/474032/17","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3701416,"name":"Mark Wasserman","username":"Mark_Wasserman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_wasserman/{size}/9677_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-04T16:54:49.481Z","cooked":"

We found that both the adapter and the coupler can be printed out of PETG CF. The adapter is easy to draw with the depth being the critical dimension (distance from the end of shaft to the VEX sun gear).

The coupler is a bit more tricky. Since we’re talkin’ about some pretty fine spline teeth, we tweak the tooth geometry in CAD until the printed geometry matches real world. There’s also proper shimming of the adapter on the motor shaft to set maximum spline engagement to the VEX sun.

This years CAD has a setup for a Minion and an X44 minus the shims.

Is it strong enough? What is the safety factor? Who knows. We’ve have abused the coupler on an X60 with 100A+ current limit and they didn’t complain thus we aren’t too scared to use them in the future AS LONG AS attention is paid to the above tricky stuff.

Disclaimer: Results may very.
